archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Lemon-Parsley Tilapia with Brown Rice Pilaf and Sautéed Asparagus
description: Mild, family-friendly tilapia baked with lemon and parsley, served with a simple brown rice pilaf and garlicky asparagus. Built for low-sodium cooking with bright herb and citrus flavor.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup brown rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Mince 2 cloves garlic (divide for rice and asparagus).
Zest 1 lemon, then cut it in half (reserve a few thin slices for the fish).
Roughly chop a small handful of parsley.
Trim woody ends from 1 bunch asparagus.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets with paper towels.
cook_steps: Start rice pilaf: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.

Stir in rinsed brown rice and half the minced garlic; toast 1 minute. Add 2 cups water, a pinch of black pepper, and lemon zest. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and simmer 35–40 minutes until tender. Keep covered off heat 5 minutes.
Bake tilapia: Place tilapia on a lined sheet pan. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil, season with black pepper, and top with a few lemon slices. Bake 10–12 minutes until the fish flakes easily.

Make quick pan drizzle: In a small skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add 2 tablespoons white wine and the juice from half the lemon; simmer 1–2 minutes to reduce slightly. Stir in half the chopped parsley and a pinch of black pepper. Remove from heat.

Sauté asparagus: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add asparagus and the remaining minced garlic; cook 4–5 minutes until crisp-tender, tossing. Finish with a squeeze of lemon.
Fluff the rice with a fork and fold in remaining parsley.
Plate: Serve tilapia with a spoon of lemon-parsley drizzle, a scoop of brown rice pilaf, and sautéed asparagus.
